related_configuration:
<module name="TreeWalker">
        <module name="LeftCurly">
              <property name="id" value="LeftCurlyEol"/>
              <property name="tokens"
                        value="ANNOTATION_DEF, CLASS_DEF, CTOR_DEF, ENUM_CONSTANT_DEF, ENUM_DEF,
                            INTERFACE_DEF, LAMBDA, LITERAL_CATCH,
                            LITERAL_DO, LITERAL_ELSE, LITERAL_FINALLY, LITERAL_FOR, LITERAL_IF,
                            LITERAL_SWITCH, LITERAL_SYNCHRONIZED, LITERAL_TRY, LITERAL_WHILE, METHOD_DEF,
                            OBJBLOCK, STATIC_INIT, RECORD_DEF, COMPACT_CTOR_DEF"/>
        </module>
    </module>
explanation: The LeftCurly check does not detect opening brace line breaks for instance initializers (non-static blocks), so patterns like '{ int x = 1; }' outside methods are not reported. As a result, enforcement is incomplete.
